title: Sour Bicycles Double Choc and Cowboy Cookie Steel Full Suspension Bikes
content:
Germany-based Sour Bicycles announced its two new steel full-suspension bikes today, the Double Choc trail and Cowboy Cookie downcountry. Petor walked us through the Double Choc last month, but let’s check out the bikes below in production detail and spec…

﻿

 

Double Choc Trail 140-160 mm Full Suspension

The Double Choc can be built up with 136mm or 148mm rear travel. This means that you can build up a short-er travel trail ripper for those quick-bites or go all the way up to 160/148mm for those really big days out.

Not only do we give you the simple beauty of the Horst-link, the Double Choc also features all the threads, bolts, and measurements to make maintenance as easy as possible.

Quick Hits:

Made in Germany frame and Sour-made chainstays
Wheel Size: 29er
Front Travel: 140-160 mm
Rear Travel: 136 or 148 mm
Suspension Design: Horst-link

See more at Sour Bicycles.

 

﻿

 

Cowboy Cookie Downcountry 120-130 mm Full Suspension

The Cowboy Cookie – seen in Quinda’s bike check – is the perfect bike for long rides, short rips, and everything in between.

What started as a full-suspension sibling to the Pasta Party XC hardtail John reviewed, slowly morphed into its own category altogether.

Sour wanted the geometry to be progressive without sacrificing the all-day nature of a more conservative geometry like the Pasta Party. Everyone loves big days out, pedaling up, down, left, and right, and the Cowboy Cookie is down(country) for all of it.

Quick Hits:

Made in Germany frame and Sour-made chainstays
Wheel Size: 29er
Front Travel: 120-130 mm
Rear Travel: 120 mm
Suspension Design: Horst-link

Pricing is set for both frames at 3499€ including German VAT, US customers at 2940€

 

See more at Sour Bicycles.
